text: after seven years various hurdles and
several delays Mumbai is ready with its
new international airport terminal from
next month this will be the gateway for
all international passengers arriving in
India's financial capital and thus
terminal will also serve as an exit
point for all those flying out of the
country now nearly a billion dollars
have been spent on the state-of-the-art
building which has been designed by the
same architects who were the brains
behind the Burj Khalifa in Dubai the
size of this terminal is bigger than
Heathrow is terminal five in London and
changies terminal 3 in Singapore the
design of this four-story glass building
is inspired by the dancing peacock which
is the country's national bird so what's
in it for passengers now there 188
check-in counters which is going to make
movement of passengers smooth and fast
other than that for people who are going
to spend a lot of time here to catch
their next slide there will be a lot of
shock paying and eating places but
arguably the most attractive feature of
this terminal is the art wall it's three
kilometers long it has seven thousand
pieces of artwork and it's been put
together by 1,500 artists this project I
would like to call it the mother of all
challenges because it can't get better
than this it's extremely complicated
because of one simple reason that we
don't have enough line and whatever land
we had is completely occupied
you know we had about 1400 acres of
available land most airports all over
the world have four to ten thousand
acres we have only 1400 acres for a
airport of this size and it was
completely occupied so when we had to
design a new airport a new terminal
rebuild the runways taxiways everything
on an airport which is an operation and
growing at 15 to 20 percent a year
precision challenge to build this
terminal several slums had to be
demolished which surrounded this area
earlier in fact some of them are still
around now this project has been hailed
as a major boost for India's
infrastructure image
but the fact is that it's a rare short
piece that has been completed in the
last few years
projects worth billions of dollars
including roads power highways and
airports have been hit by delays and
this is considered one major reason for
India's economic growth slowing down so
on one hand this project is a major step
forward but India's overall
infrastructure still struggles
